intro: Diploloma echioides, commonly known as the spiny diploloma, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its erect, branching stems and dense clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant has rough, often spiny leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland and savanna habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
